dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDS HOWL. Rain drives horizontal. The sea surges up,  nearly to the flight deck of the Aircraft Carrier USS Kit Hawk. The carrier plunges, driving its bow into a wall of grey water. The deck pitches forward and back, rolls left right, and yaws in a corkscrew motion. The entire 93,000 behemoth rises and falls in the TYPHOON-DRIVEN SWELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROAR. Silver wings flash by, a cockpit, fiery jet  exhausts. A forty ton monster drops at 120 knots into an the size of a tennis court in a CONTROLLED CRASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2A.  A SHOWER OF SPARKS, A SCREECH OF RUBBER AND METAL as the gear hits the deck. The hook catches the 3 wire and t F-14 TOMCAT is slammed to a halt. It's the scariest thing you've ever seen, the most dangerous maneuver in aviation just another day at the office for a Naval Aviator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leans almost horizontal into the winds. He holds the pick controlling the landing lights and speaks into a mike. Hi calm, professional commands belie the extreme conditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It slams in. The pilot hits full power, catches the wire, to a stop, cuts his engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of scopes and electronic gear. The CARRIER CONTROL A OFFICER (CCA) watches a blip on radar, reaches for his mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float like gods, above the storm, above the cloud cove looking down. From overhead, a probe slides into frame, t a graceful nose. The cockpit sides by, Pilot, then Radar  Intercept Officer (RIO) barely illuminated by the orange of their instruments. The fuselage gracefully swells to t enormous air intakes, then variable angle wings, swept ba for high speed flight. Twin tailbooms cant outward,  horizontal stabilizers make constant adjustments. Enormou twin jet exhaust ports glow red in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We become aware of WIND WHISTLE, JET ENGINE SOUNDS, RADIO STATIC. The pilot, COUGAR, is calm, steady. The Radar  Intercept Officer in the backseat, GOOSE, is a wildman,  always an edge of humor in his voice. A UHF transmission  breaks in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost immediately the RIO picks up a target and responds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in on the cockpit with stenciled name and call signs EVAN MITCHELL is the pilot, MAVERICK. In flight suit and mask, we can only see his eyes. they are confident. In hi mid-twenties, he is lean, hard, athletic...the archetype pilot. His rear-seater is LTJG. WALTER MERLIN; WIZARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick peels off to right, to high cover position; 5 o'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADS UP DISPLAY (HUD) glows dimly on the windscreen. Dir in front of the stick, two CRT screens display data. The screen shows a radar sweep. Wedged between the instrument snapshot of a pretty young woman with a 2 month-old baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying in combat spread, 1 mile abeam, higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing at 900 knots, The MiG is a speck, then a flash an ROAR, a knife-edge pass at 300 feet. It rockets past his wing tip and disappears. Cougar kicks rudder, whips the s screams into a tight turning roll and dives after him. He the throttle forward to ZONE 5 AFTERBURNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick sees a SECOND MiG drop from above onto Cougar's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick swings after him, lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They punch through cloud cover into the soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is closing on the first MiG when a shocking BLIPBLIPBL tone breaks into their headsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a six strobe.  I think  he's locked on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a MiG 21. They don't have  radar missiles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar swings mad gyrations, cutting back and forth acros front MiG's tailpipe, trying to break the lock-on. The TO more insistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lordy!  Eyeball to Asshole. Hope nobody burps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'LL LOCK ON THEM, COUGAR. (to himself)   Gotcha covered, don't nobody move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER, COUGAR. (to himself and his RIO)  Okay boys, pull out with your hands up  and nobody'll get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up front, Cougar checks his gunsight...He gets I.R. lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're locked on MiG ONE. Why  doesn't he disengage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are getting on my  nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cougar presses forward, and MiG TWO stays on his tail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger gives way to discipline. Cougar's Tomcat breaks lef dives into dense cloud. MiG TWO still follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls over into wild evasive maneuvers, finally breaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaks out of cloud, looks around, startled.  There is no no F-14. He scans the sky frantically, while rolling the  aircraft. ...Suddenly, he feels a presence. He looks stra and behind him. A few feet away, a TOMCAT slides into pos canopy to canopy, an incredible feat of flying. Maverick Wizard stare at him. Maverick slides even closer, canopie touching. The MiG pilot acknowledges them with a weak wav Maverick stares for a moment, then flips him the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MiG pushes negative G, hard down and away. He heads f deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the thrill of victory and the  agony of defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of feet, fuel's down to  4.0.  We're gonna get them wet  unless we find a Sonoco station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands the on plunging deck, peering into the roaring nig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. How the hell we  supposed to land on something we  can't even see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if it was easy, everybody  would want to come up here and do  it..... Instead of just us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the ball?  I don't see the  ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLASTS slam the airframe. Rain tattoos the canopy. A gust the Tomcat, he straightens it, A gust flips it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carrier lights appear and disappear through the storm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walk in the park, Mustang. You  with me, cat man?...Cougar...you  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose is thrown about as the wing dips, straightens, dips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with this one, I'm really  screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it left. Bring it left,  You're high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you feel it? I'm hanging in  my straps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not. We're level. Look at  the instruments, we're okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be broken. I'm hanging in  my straps! We're inverted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not! Trust me! We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears Cougar's chatter over the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's plane settles in over the ramp, suddenly, BLAS IT'S AFTERBURNERS...it ROARS over the deck without touchi off into the night. The LSO is shocked into comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think we can get  back in?  We don't have the fuel  for this. MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's nine o'clock high. We're two  thousand pounds low!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's plane pulls up behind Cougar's. Cougar's plane suddenly flips over, flying inverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick pulls up off the wing of the inverted aircraft. voice is calmness itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar's plane completes the roll, is now upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on vapor, Cougar, you got to  put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crazy, man. Instruments are  crazy. We're gonna have to eject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick pulls up wing tip to wing tip, inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the weather! They'll never  find us! We're near out of fuel.  Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have mine, Cougar. It'll be  where your head used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on what they can see of the approach of the planes. Maverick drops him off at the pattern and circles LSO watches the approach. The Tomcat drops a wing, straig drops the wing, straightens ... the approach of a pilot  experiencing vertigo as Cougar tries to satisfy his inner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wind shear just off the ramp drives the plane suddenly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AFTERBURNERS BLAST, but the Tomcat horrifyingly settles t toward the deck. The deck crew watches in terror as the p wallows in toward them. The LSO'S turn, take a few steps throw themselves off the flight deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sail into the night toward the surging seas a hundre below, then are caught in safety nets hung off the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settles, settles, standing on it's engines, trying to arr it's downward momentum. The hook raises sparks as it skid the deck... The plane stops falling and hangs for a momen to blast back up, when the hook catches the last wire.. T snags it, plucking 45,000 pounds of fuel, metal and men o the air and slamming it all to the deck. WHAMMMM! Right w flies up the deck and over the side...the gear collapses. plane SCREECHES sideways. The crew watches helplessly as slams into it and comes to rest in cloud of fuel vapor an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LSO runs up, shouting into the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crash crew leaps into action. The fire crew is there. The the Silver Suit jumps up on the wing and crawls to the co The figures inside are not moving. He hits the canopy rel The canopy pops open. Silver suit grabs at the rear seat release. He screams through his suit's aluminized cloth..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose, can you hear me?  Goose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing for a moment. He's dead! Then the RIO'S helmet  moves...His head turns. He tears the mask away from his f looks up at Silver Suit. His head clears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver suit is stunned for a moment. He straightens up, h inclines quizzically. Then it hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will put it up front, with the Porsches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs him under the armpits, drags him out of the plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...easy...Take it easy... I'm a veteran!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose grabs a passing crewman by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you check under the hood. I  thought I heard a funny noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other crewmembers help Cougar out. He seems stunned, but reacts to his fear with frantic one-liners. He grabs a cr member's radio, as Silver Suit helps him away and looks t figures of the Admiral and the Air Boss far up on the bri He waves to them, does his best impression...Desi Arnaz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of disbelief... Then hysterical, tension relievi laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose spots Cougar being helped out. He pulls away, reach into the cockpit and grabs Cougar's snapshot of wife and They lead Goose away as firemen blast the aircraft with f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it extra for the hot wax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TILLIE, a four wheel mobile crane, slams up to the plan slings its lifting harness. Goose turns to Silver Suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Goose. He's alright. Bring it  left...You're settling.  IS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wizard does a quick sign of the cross, reaches down, grab balls...as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOMCAT slams onto the deck, clearing the wreckage by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch as they bring a shaken Cougar past. Goose, eyes wil waves at Maverick and Wizard, rolling up. They flame out VVOOOMMMMM! They sit there, immobile, waiting for a tow, numb.  Goose does his "stewardess".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of your Captain and your  crew, I want to thank you for  flying VF101. And next time your  plans include the middle of the  goddamn ocean in the dead of  frigging night, I hope you'll think  of Naval Aviation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surgeon looks into Goose's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wobbling off) Never mind my head, check my  shorts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar lies alone in the dimness, staring at the overhead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual CLANGS, WHISTLES, ENGINES of Navy life sound FO ECHOING through the dim, deserted passage. From the dista single figure passes in and out of the glow of the overhe lights. Cougar comes closer, hobbling unsteadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches a door, pulls himself erect and knocks on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skipper works at his desk, responds without looking u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up. Cougar stands in the doorway, a strange, daz on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar, what is it? You should be  in sick bay. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the skipper's desk. His eyes are glazed, his jaw is firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking of my wife and kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A determined movement. Hand to chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something metal hits it, skids across the polished surfac clangs up against the coffee mug: gold wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar comes out of Stinger's room, bumps into Goose, and Maverick. He turns the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, turns to them. There is nothing to say. Goose h him his snapshot. Cougar looks at his wife and kid for a then looks up at them. He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cougar?                STINGER (O.S.) Maverick, Goose...Come in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick appears, followed by Goose. They stand at  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper says nothing. Maverick sees the wings on the  desk. He enters, walks over, stares down at them. He pick them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked a man back once. Three  months later, we lost him. It's his  decision. Only he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the best you have. He's going  Top Gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was going. (Turns to Maverick.) Now  you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick stares at the wings, lost in conflicting emotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's going (indicating Goose)  and he needs someone to fly the  plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it, he did it himself.  Something about a wife and kid. The  fact is, he's lost it. He knows it.  I know it. You were up there, you  know it, too. GOOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a break, Skipper. It was  raining snakes up there. He'll be  alright, soon as all the gorillas go  home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper stares at Goose, non-plussed for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know some RIOS are a little  wiggy...but you abuse the  priviledge! I don't believe I'm  going to have to put the two of you  in the same cockpit...but there it  is! It may be good for the Navy. It  might be good for you, but most of  all, it's good for me. It'll get  you out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Skipper, Cougar's been picked  for Top Gun...He's the best of the  best!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll just have to make do  with him (indicates Maverick).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a hell of a flyer. In fact,  he's so damn good he might have  been picked for Top Gun himself.  Except for one thing. (SCREAMS) He  just can't seem to follow orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinger moves slightly, to stand now, directly in front o Maverick and speak eye to eye at four inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just did an incredibly brave thing!  What you should have done was land your  plane. You don't own that plane, the  taxpayers do. I should ream you out for  it. But it just doesn't work with you.  You're a hell of a flyer. You are maybe  ...too good. You never really stepped in  it yet. So this is your chance. I'm  gonna send you up against the best. They  are better than you. Maybe they'll knock  that shine off your eagle and you'll  see, finally, where discipline and  teamwork fit it.  Maverick hasn't really heard anything but TOPGUN. He snap of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is all. Tell me about the MiG  some other time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps off a salute and does an about face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the wings in his hands, slowing walks ov places them gently on the Skipper's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Goose push through a gauntlet of aircrews. T have become notorious. Guys grab at them...questions...th MiGs?..What happened up there? How close did they get? Wh the MiGs do? One word is heard over and over..."TopGun". left behind in the crowd. Maverick pushes through. He wal fast...faster. Up ladders, around turns, down ladders, th passageways. Faster. He breaks into a trot, then a canter squeezing past enlisted men, parts lockers, then he break run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch slams open on the side of the Carrier. He's out o catwalk, instantly soaked, running on rain slicked stairs cantilevered high over the breaking seas. He plunges forw the bow of the ship, stands on the very peak. He is yelli something. He stands there as the bow plunges terrifyingl the trough. The water rises like a green mountain, up, up break just a few feet below him, showering him with spray noise is incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come around on his face. It is maddened. He raises his fi punches the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foaming slope of the wave rushes up, changing color a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big bike, a real big bike, a turbo...rockets across the desert. Fast. Real fast. Aviator shades low above the han --Maverick. Goose hangs on in back. It cranks faster, pul closer...ENGINE SCREAMING. It cranks up a notch, it's goi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: explode. It can't go faster, but it does. It SCREAMS HIGH ROARS under, by and away, leaving dust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Just the HISS AND POP OF METAL COOLING. Maverick on it, staring out past us. Goose looks over Maverick's s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see why. Feet come into the frame. Then the uniform:  California Highway Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40A.  ANGLE ON MAVERICK. CHP enters the frame, the usual  hypercivil arrogance tinged with awed disbelief. The usua questions are spaced for effect as if he might be talking other form of life. Maverick is off the bike, standing at attention. Goose follows more slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son. Do you know why I stopped you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick has some good idea how to deal with authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHP adjusts his own aviator shades. CHP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more than sincere) Sir. You are going to give me a  warning, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHP - A touch of a smile, quickly surpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick hands them over with his Navy ID. CHP scans them hesitates a moment over the last, looks up with a touch m respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, do you know how fast   you were going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. I was going Mach point one  five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One SIXTH the speed of sound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a guess) Lieutenant... What do you...   usually fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause. Respect in the cop's eyes. He taps the Navy the handlebars...staring at this sincere young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant... Is there... a Russian attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir! But you have to be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop nods and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike is BLURPING... barely going fast enough to stay  upright. Maverick cool in shades and campaign cap dorks p hanger with the sign: FIGHTERTOWN, USA. He pulls ahead. I of him, escorting with flashers...the CHP. They pull up a gate. Maverick and Goose salute the guard, hands over the The CHP gets out of his car, leans against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of this gate... I...am Top Gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He salutes. The CHP returns a snappy one. He gets back in car and turns away. Maverick receives his ID and clearanc passes through, a couple of pilots in flight suits (ICE A HOLLYWOOD) stare at him. The taller, dark, cool one speak dry voice, meant to be overheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, police escort. This one must  be a real killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second pilot grins big at them. Maverick turns slight stares over his shades at them as he passes. Goose grins challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doors on the soundtrack.  Jets swoop, missiles fire, explodes. Gun camera views of MiGs, SAMS, flak, bombing r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the Korean War, the Navy kill  ratio was twelve-to-one. We shot down  twelve of their jets for every one of  ours. In Vietnam, this ratio fell to  three-to-one. Our pilots depended on  missles. They lost their dogfighting  skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F-14's fighting with F-5's. Music becomes current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top Gun was created to teach ACM. Air  Combat Maneuvering...Dogfighting.  Richthofen, Guynemer, Rickenbacker,  Galland, Rudel, Bong would envy us. We  do just what they did, but we do it  beyond the speed of sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIPER - A tough-looking, confident leader in a blue fligh stands before a video-tape monitor. Behind him, on the mo the dogfighting continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the end of Vietnam we upped our  kill ratio to thirteen to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on the lights. We see his audience in F.G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here 'cause you're the top  one per cent of all naval aviators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen young men - eight flight crews - sit at attention are trim, fit and confident - high school heroes, college

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the elite, the best of the  best. We're gonna make you better,  because you're job is damned  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves among them. Hold on one of the men; the greeted Maverick at the gate, Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the tensions in the world today, the potential for c tation is greater than ever, and  carrier pilots will be the first  ones there. Air combat excellence  is vital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice is not looking at the speaker, but, rather, in our  direction. HOLLYWOOD, a blond, good-looking pilot, whispe something to him, and gestures. Ice is getting the lowdow someone. The camera moves and we see who that someone is, Maverick enters the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Someone once asked me if  training men for air combat made  the world less safe--flying loaded  guns... an accidental confrontation  and so forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick feels the stare of the other man and glances in direction. Their eyes meet. Ice smiles coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My answer is: the dangerous thing  is being unprepared. You want  trouble, that's what you get when  things don't work out, when you  can't do what you say you can. When  you don't know what you can do. And  when your opponents aren't sure  either. We are not policy. We don't  make policy. Elected officials  ...civilians, do that. We are the  instrument of policy. The tip of  the spear. So we had best be sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick has turned to look at Ice. Ice glances back in h direction. Maverick looks at the back of the room where g blue flight suits stand. They are the instructors. They l relaxed, poised, mean.  Goose is looking up front...Where has stopped. Goose nudges Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...That's McGown...that's  Singer, isn't it? GOOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, pay attention. What  are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing to himself) ...Just wondering...(turns back)  ...who is the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's shocked to find Viper staring right at him, with a k grin on his face. He's feels caught like a naughty school

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really...    (smiles) Ya know. We'd like to know who's  best too. That's why we've got that  plaque on the wall... with the Top  Top Gun crew from each class. You  think maybe your name's gonna be on  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick knows he's in trouble, considers the social  alternatives, then tells him the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of ooo's and aahh's from the guys. The instructo stare the challenge at him. He slides lower in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering the company you're in,  that's a pretty arrogant attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that in a fighter pilot.   (couple of laughs from the guys)  It's okay to be confident. You have  to think you're King Kong to want  to try to land on carriers. Just  keep in mind the other component of  success...teamwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper gathers his notes, the lecture is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper turns back for one more thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is about combat.  Remember, there are no points for  second place. Dismissed. Viper walks out. Maverick finds Goose looking at him,  quizzically. Others mill around the plaque.  A big, frien of a RIO speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the plaque. The winner can  get assigned here as instructor. He  gets to fight every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move closer to examine the names on the plaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast cars in the driveway, fast music blares into the  night. It's Wednesday; Animal Night. Maverick, Goose  Hollywood and Wolfman walk to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud music, low ceiling, plaques of the squadrons line th walls. A dancer gyrates on stage, largely ignored by pilo talking with their hands. Every pretty girl in San Diego  seems to be here. It's a noisy, rowdy place--a "steam  releaser" for people under pressure. Nevertheless, there a control to it all, there are none of the usual bar type just pilots and Naval Officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost Riders enter. The place is on fire:  a mob of  dancers, flashing lights, blaring HARD ROCK MUSIC. Beer  flows. Pilots talk flying and hustle girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEARBY - AN A7 pilot stands by the bar. He knows Goose an speaks loudly for his benefit..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the Fighter Pilots motto?  It's better to be dead than to look  bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grin broadly. Goose replies as they brush past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Frank, anybody gets  off on bombing the shit out of dirt  has got to be queer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose exchanges friendly punches with the attack pilots.  Maverick's introductions and friendly barbs are drowned b music. Maverick is a bit reserved. He doesn't move among crowd as naturally as Goose does. Hollywood and Wolfman d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: away, searching for quarry. Goose orders beer. He nods to TALL YOUNG MAN across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller, Black Lion Squadron. I knew  him at Pensacola. He's damn good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anybody in the Navy you  don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta keep track of the  competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose suddenly reaches out and grabs a guy moving past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slider -- they let you into Top  Gun? If you're among the best in  the Navy, I tremble for the  security of this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Goose, whose butt did you kiss  to get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The list is long, but  distinguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles good-naturedly, shakes hands with Mav.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can stay up with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think, yeah, we'll show you a  thing or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Evan Mitchell, he steers  the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I heard. Steers it pretty close.  Sorry to hear about Cougar. He was  a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, behind them, a flame shoots up. Someone ducks h and swallows it. The pilot sets an empty glass on the bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flaming Hooker. Sort of an  institution around here. Or maybe  this is the institution, I forget  which. It's the house drink. It'll  warm the cockles of your heart ...  and other things depending on where  you spill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to the barmaid and she moves over, sets them u GOOSE holds a demitasse glass. The barmaid pours Drambuie look at Goose apprehensively. Goose looks at nearby flyer Camo fatigues. GOOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't show fear in front of  Marines...They're like Doberman's  they'll go for your throat, it's  instinctive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out match and lights it. Maverick holds his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs it all in one gulp, slaps the glass on the bar, aflame. He stands there, blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could use a dash more jet fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others are duly impressed. Maverick's gaze falls on I watching from the end of the bar - Slider takes one, Mave takes one too, downs it in a gulp. Sundown, taking up the challenge, motions for one. The barmaid pours it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, don't make an ash of  yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to drink the flaming concoction. He tries to go sip, but it's too close to his face, he tries to tilt the away, but that doesn't work. Finally he goes for the gulp burns his lip and misses.  He sets his hair on fire. It g in a WHOOOSH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a beer in Sundown's face, quenching the fire. S blinks through the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are not only crazy, you're  dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice comes up from the end of the bar. He motions the Barm another; it comes. Goose lights it. He gulps it down, coo hell. ICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away. Slider goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit! That why they call him Ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. It's the way he flies - Ice cold.  No mistakes. Wears you down. After  enough time, you just get bored and  frustrated, you do something stupid, and  he's got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick moves in Ice's direction. He passes Wolfman danc with a girl with bright purple fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you all have such funny  names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta have a call sign that's  just your own...never changes...you  have to recognize it immediately.  Then, if someone shouts "Wolf,  break left!"..you react right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they call you Wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose comes up with his arm around a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mav, this is Sally. She doesn't  believe a word I say. Tell her I'm  married, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's married--but then again,  he,s not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally laughs and tries to pull Goose back toward the danc floor. Something in Maverick's eyes makes him hang back w partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I get a call sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know. That depends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn't just happen, you  gotta do something famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick smiles at this, but seems on edge... He watches pretty girls enter and eye the pilots in their flight sui turns and walks up to Ice, who sits, drinking with Slider Maverick walks over to him. Ice notices Slider's attentio to Maverick. He turns and grins at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can work it out on my  own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to work alone. I've heard  that about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of you, too. You were in  124 with Bargamian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were with Cougar. He was my  roommate in flight school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have soloed under a lucky  star. First the MiG, then you slide  into Cougar's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Cougar's place. It's ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it was? Was it  that MiG contact that did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here because we're the best  flyers in the wing. Not because of  some MiG encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What luck! Guys fly their whole  career without seeing a MiG up  close...You're famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in the way he says it. It's not quite a joke, m insult. Maverick's about to take the whole conversation t when something...someone catches his eye. She catches qui eyes in this room. She is very pretty and she's walking i arm of a Commander. Maverick turns back, but the moment h passed. Ice dismisses him with a nod and weak smile. Goos him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do these guys think, I made  Cougar quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay no attention to it. They're  just trying to rattle you. It's all  psychological. Sit down..and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He deposits Maverick at a chair by a table where other pi cluster watching and listening to Bugs shoot down his wri Maverick broods... BUGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were just really diving down and by  then we were right over downtown  Haiphong.  It was some great shit. Jack  says, "What are you doing?" "What, what  am I doing, Jack?" He says, "What are  you doing?" I said, "I'm rolling in,  Jack." "Bugs, we're at thirty-two  hundred feet. Oh shit, we were like  zooom... So we scraped down at hundred  feet right over--downtown Hanoi!  Oh  shit, goddamn it! And blowing down the  river. And so once we were there we let  down to about fifty feet just going down  the river and Jack says... "Bugs...  don't ever do that again!" "Okay, right,  Jack, I'll never do that again!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick pays little or no attention. He broods and drink Suddenly, Hollywood nudges him, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Long legs, great ass, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her six is a ten! Uh oh, a turn to  engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick sees a stranger, and somehow he knows, he knows then.  Wolfman turns, sees her walking too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine thirty. Bogey?  You presume  that hostile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we should contact and check  it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has turned toward them. She passes by. They start to move for her. But just then she finds her date at the bar distinguished man with Captain's stripes. Their smiles fr they slide back in their chairs. Maverick can't stop look her...After a while, the intensity of his gaze draws her  attention. She feels him. She is nodding and smiling to h but her eyes scan the room like radar. A warning tone goe his brain dolu dolu dolu as they lock on him. He feels th thrill of excitement and fear you get when you know you'r targeted in someone's scope. Her eyes hold on him for a l moment...long enough, and then sweep by the rest of the r turns her attention back to the Captain and laughs at som he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over in a corner, Goose chats up a couple of San Diego gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family unit -- that's the most  important thing. It's the only  thing you can count on. I'm married  --did I tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four times. We don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been married since I was  eighteen. Why don't you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even wearing a ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) I take it off when I'm chasing  women. It's the only honorable  thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's half listening to Bugs rattle on.  His eyes are draw to the woman. He tries not to stare. She seems to know a people in the club. He looks away. Hollywood is chatting girl with a sincerity that cannot be taught. His line is polished as his appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think about death up  there, but you think a lot about  the danger. One mistake and you're  a smoking hole in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew it was so dangerous. HOLLYWOOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, it makes everything down  here more meaningful. You feel a  certain intensity of life, and you  want to grab onto every moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks up at the bar again. A shock. She (Charlie staring right at him, intensely, as her date whispers som in her ear. She notices him, staring back, quickly looks embarrassed. She says something to the man. He nods and t away as someone else grabs his attention. The woman, now look this way for anything. She picks up her purse from t and walks through the crowd and out of the room. Impulsiv Maverick's up, he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks out, looks around, doesn't see her. Someone dis around a corner. He moves after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORNER - A door slams shut. Impulsively, before he realiz he is doing, he's through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A feminine GASP!  He should have looked at the sign on th The realization of where he is hits him too late. She is by the mirror, with her make-up out, looking back at him. not quite sure what to do. A hasty retreat would be appro if embarrassing. Ah, what the hell, he is a fighter pilot just walks right over to her...no idea what he will say. got her lipstick out, twisting it. She looks over at him amused smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over the sink, puts on lipstick, sees his eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I can do to help, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. He is sort of attractive, but there are other in the room, she doesn't want to be too encouraging...She not to grin at his embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh...Anything I can do for you? She laughs again, doesn't know what it is...could be chem but she's instinctively attracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hold this. It might be safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a makeup mirror. Starts redoing her lipstic just stares at her...She looks up at him, than back to he warpaint. Finally, when it comes, it is cool and amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know why all the girls come  here. They know how horny you guys  get. But this...is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mock anger. She's toying with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it is. It is that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big comfort to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save you from a big mistake with  that other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on to a bigger one with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there ever a girl who didn't  like fighter pilots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs again, shakes her head...another cowboy! She g takes the compact out of his hands, snaps it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really flattered, Lieutenant,  but I don't go out with pilots. MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three pretty blondes enter and look at Maverick quizzical not without interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the question is...what are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to keep a straight face as she walks out of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other girls look at him expectantly.  A beat.  He jus stands there, then realizes he's holding her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm here to talk about a new  concept in cosmetics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47A.  WOXOF BAR. She returns, spots the Captain, motionin her.  Maverick enters, goes to the other end of the bar. orders a drink. It comes. He drinks it, pays for it, move toward the door. Someone backs into his path, he moves qu and bumps into someone else; her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fault. Should have watched where I was going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand goes to his collar. She adjusts his insignia. Sh smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your wing man? Who's  watching your six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks the spell abruptly, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I walk you out?She turns back to him, a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a car in the parking lot, we see Charlie and the Cap leave the club. They walk directly toward us and stop. Sh says something polite...a peck on the cheek. He turns awa dome light briefly illuminates the interior of the car as opens. It rocks slightly as someone gets in. Charlie turn and walks over, taking her keys out. She opens the door t car and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts the car and pulls away. Suddenly, a figure sit the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, she nearly drives off the road. She turns to hi startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if Captain Dawson had come  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have been really  embarrassing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know this was my car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple deduction. It's fast. It's  pretty. Sleek and stylish...It's  your color...matches your lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls up at the guard gate, a MARINE CORPORAL is on d sees the pretty girl pull up and stop, leans over helpful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Corporal. Can you do  anything about this lunatic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car door swings open. Maverick gets out. The car roar He stands in the glare of the spotlight...rocking on his looking across at the guard, who snaps to attention and s holes in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guys in flight suits run down stairs past stencils of kills on walls, then down corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They skid to stop outside a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground crews work on planes in B.G. Jester in middle of l Door bursts open. Sundown and Flex skid to a halt when th whole class looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flex...? You don't look like Flex   to me. You call that muscle?  Doesn't look like muscle. Looks  like...Pork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh. Even Sundown has to laugh, scratching his che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you laughing at? You're  Fungus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make an issue of it, it'll  stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now to continue. In this class we  will be dealing with F-5's and  A4's, as our MiG simulators.  Technically the F-5 does not have  the thrust to weight ratio of the  MiG-21--it also does not bleed  energy below 300 knots like the  MiG-21 does. The A4 does not turn  as well as the MiG-17 but has  significantly better visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks back to his notes. SFX footsteps...door  opening. Viper looks up to back of room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Charlie. Good, our TAGREF's  here. Charlie's the most qualified  to get into P subs and curves, and  VN diagrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick turns to see the TAGREF walk forward.  Maverick  stares at her as she passes without acknowledging him. He surprised, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte Blackwood--code name Charlie--  not your ordinary TAGREF. Charlie has  her Ph.D. in astrophysics--she's a  civilian contractor so you don't salute  her...or anything else. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the front and starts her presentation. She  talks about something very technical, arcane. MiG tactics technology. As the briefing rattles on, Maverick reacts t her. Goose glances over at him. He, too, recognizes the g He looks at his partner. Maverick feels his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I think I have some new data for  you...Now a MiG 21 has a problem with  the inverted flight tanks. It won't do a  Negative G push over. Even below one G,  they risk a flame out. Operationally,  they will do a zero to one G only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snicker from the audience. She hesitates momentarily, g on. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The latest intelligence shows that  the most they will do in operation  is one....is there something wrong,  Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're altogether  right...about the MiG, that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops--some of the pilots look at him. Viper glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I beg yours. But I don't think  you're right on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a MiG do a 4 G negative dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She doesn't believe him) Where did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous buzz in the room. Viper goes rigid. Charlie can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's classified. Like Hollywood  says, I could tell you, but then  I'd have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pork stifles a laugh, the others chuckle. Viper is  embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops Viper with a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can handle it. She is very cool, not overbearing. She says it calmly. She doesn't want to embarrass him any mor than he is, but she has to get the facts straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I have a top secret  clearance. The Pentagon sees to it  that I know more than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flatly.) You saw a MiG push negative 4G?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in a 4G Negative dive and  you were on his six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am, At first. Then I was  directly above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him for a moment, then she has him. She goe for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were directly above him, how  did you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real buzz in the room.  Ice laughs audibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in a 4G inverted dive with  a MiG 21?   (She can't believe it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckles, barely suppressed. Goose pipes up to deflect  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One and a half, actually. I got a  polaroid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open laughter. She thinks it's at her. She grows red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows her, but she can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the reason those SALT talks failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room breaks into laughter. At him. Now he grows red.  Goose puts his hand on Maverick's arm, shakes his head as to say: "Let it go, pal, she got you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Viper. He doesn't know whether to laugh or c He knows there's something here he doesn't control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like he says, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. He runs up and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me you were a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies him coolly for a moment, like a specimen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me make a fool of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seemed determined to do that  anyway.. Why didn't you tell me you  were a famous MiG insulter? MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it have made a difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm assigned to this  school. I see sixteen new hotshots  every eight weeks. Your attention  is flattering, but not really  productive. Why don't you keep your  mind on flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over and aligns his collar insignia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you keep this straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him and walks away. Maverick turns, sees th others sizing him up. Most of them grin. Maverick moves d the corridor past the CO's Office. Viper leans against th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: doorsill. He lights a pipe, laconically eyes Maverick. Hi tone gives away nothing, like an ELINT probe eliciting a  response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick... Where'd you get that  call sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh... Runs in the family, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick watches him for a beat, he's been tested, but he not sure how or why. He turns to catch up with Goose and others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At twenty-eight thousand feet, the two planes circle each other, going in opposite directions. As they jockey for  position, they snap past each other like ends of bullwhip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The earth spins, the horizon appears and disappears. With each hard turn, Maverick and Goose can be heard "grunting keep blood in their brains, to keep from passing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight is hard, physical, and exhausting. The extreme forces--6.5--flatten them against their seats, causing th heads to weigh over one hundred pounds. Maverick strains turn his head and track the other jet as it streaks past Mach One.  MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost him -- where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your six -- coming hard. Four  hundred. Losing airspeed! He's on  your six and closing fast! Hard left! HARD LEFT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick jerks the stick left, and the F-14 takes an  astonishing turn. Jester ROARS past into a wide arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it down. Let's bug out of  here. Call for a draw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I'll nail him this time.  Going vertical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PLANE EXPLODES INTO AFTERBURNER - rocketing toward  space. Jester is left in direct line with the sun, and hi canopy is sprayed with a blinding glare. Going ballistic dangerous. The plane flys like a bullet, obeying the laws physics, not the pilot's touch on control surfaces. The  ballistic call warns other aircraft that he is, for the  moment, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out of energy! You got  control? Unload!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-14 peels over the egg, in a backward dive. It rocke down the outside, gaining energy. Over the ROAR of jets, SCREAM of the wind, Goose shouts data, but it is muffled, distant voice in a typhoon. Through the canopy, we see  Jester, and he hangs in the air like a sparrow in the pat a falcon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT'S POV - HUD in windscreen - a diamond in a box.  Maverick lines up the diamond with Jester, and we hear th high pitched tone BEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. We're at ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I got you, sucker. You're  going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester maneuvers, but Maverick keeps him in the gunsight. The BEEPING is louder, faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the envelope. FOX TWO MISSILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an edge of anger in Jester's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are brought up short for a moment, then the thrill o victory gets the best of them. Goose lets out a war whoop The F-14 sweeps up, rolls into an Immelman..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Ma, top of the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's Tomcat breaks hard and high, rolls over on its side, wings perpendicular to the ground. Goose sees the w go sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh...A little high on the left,  don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aileron rolls another quarter turn. Inverted, they pas right down the runway.  Goose looks out and insouciantly  watches the world go by at 300 knots, upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Much better. ...Ahhh...what  do you call this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't call it victory.  It's  more like...self immolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers work. Officers watch the landing activity. On old salt, turns from the coffee machine, a cup of steamin Java microns from his lips. A ROAR. VABOOM! The Tomcat ro over. He yelps as hot coffee flys all over his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They complete the roll, bank left, zoom right by the towe level with the observation window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52D.  F-14'S POV. Controllers look out at the F-14, mouth drop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...Hi there. How ya doing in  there?  Mav... Ahhh...you know, at  one point I did want a Navy career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see all those guys with gold on  their shoulders!!?... Oh, no, I  think that was Johnson, Air Boss of  the Kitty Hawk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we beat an instructor. How  many times in your life do you get  to do a victory roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once, if they take your plane  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They roll out, break over the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Goose walk by parking Tomcats...Ice is  unstrapping, Slider is climbing down. Ice looks at Maveri says one word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Always a good idea to show up  your instructors. He nods toward Jester, glaring at them from his A4. Goose indicates the backseat of the Tomcat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, see any controls back there?  (thinks about team loyalty,  reacts to Jester's glare...) And anyway...we beat the Son of a  Bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs to catch up with Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilots half undressed. Maverick and Goose enter the room, carrying their helmets. The students look up at them, and Goose suddenly flashes a thumb's up sign with a grin. The students react with clenched fists, ad libs, high fives,  victory punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds. That's all it took  to blow us out of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went like this, he went like  that. I say to Hollywood: Where'd  he go? Hollywood says: where'd who  go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's laughing. Right over the  radio, He's laughing at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention turns to the doorway as Ice and Slider enter. I gives a brief dramatic pause, then flashes thumbs up and  smiles. The students celebrate Ice's win.  Ice handles th attention with the easy composure of one who is used to i Maverick ignores him and begins to peel out of his G-suit Ice moves toward his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won.  Congratulations.                HOLLYWOOD Maverick and Goose won too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won!  Ice turns back, stares them down, then turns back into hi locker, dismissing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the hard deck doesn't count.  You guys are the second team,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick gets up, moves to him, starts to say something,  when Jester, breaks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING AND YELLING.  A lot of screaming and yelling,  muffled by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enlisted Yeomen and Chiefs go about their clerical duties acute embarrassment mixed with curiousity. Behind the CO' someone is screaming his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The door bursts open. A big, brawling Officer - Joh the Air Boss - blasts out, nearly smashing into a female officer. She almost spills her coffee. Johnson looks righ left in fury too strong for words. He looks like he wants smash something. They move out of his way, but he justs b through the door and disappears down the hall. The enlisted men turn to Viper's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester stands inside stonefaced. Maverick and Goose are  rigid. Viper...with excess calm deliberation, softly walk over, grasps the doornob. He glances in this direction. T glance is totally without expression, and even scarier fo that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, each man finds something totally engrossing i his work, or something terribly important to do elsewhere Slowly, steadily, Viper swings his door closed.54.  INT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over to face Maverick. There is a SILENCE like  after a train wreck; nothing but the POPPING of sprung me and the low GASP of escaping steam. Viper speaks quietly, like a funeral director consoling the living. Makes you w to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester almost breaks into a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...in addition...you broke two  major rules of engagement. And...  That's ...not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick gives no response. Viper continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Candela lost sight of  you, and called "no joy". You  failed to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and looks at Maverick... A beat. Maverick finall nods  VIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is exhausted. It's been a long, rough day. His  voice is a horse whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him in view. I was peeling  over the egg, into a dive. He saw  me when I moved in for the kill.  There wasn't any danger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Goose) Is that how you remember it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. By the time we could  respond, we were diving right into  his view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper is not satisfied with the answer, but he moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hard deck for this hop was ten  thousand feet. Jester, at what  point did you call off the fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't below for more than ten  seconds. There was no danger. I had  the shot. I took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rules of engagement are not  flexible. They exist for your   safety. You will obey them. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick thinks about continuing the discussion, but the  thought is momentary. He quickly cuts his losses, gives V what he thinks he wants...He is just on the cusp of too  sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, perfectly clear. I guess  we were ...I was... just a little  over enthusiastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper measures him for a moment, then lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Goose leave the room. Viper looks at Jester, picks up Maverick's fitness report. Doesn't read it, look back at Jester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you,  Skip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If you had to go into combat,  would you want him with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester turns, walks slowly around the room. The walls are lined with pictures; planes and pilots...history. There a MiG killers, attack squadrons, ground personnel...There's picture of a Phantom in flight with the backseater moonin the camera. Other pictures show carriers, famous flyers,  previous CO's. Finally Jester replys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper slaps shut the fitness report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's seat of the pants...  Completely unpredictable -- nothing  by the book. All over the sky. But  I don't know, Skip, he's really got  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we get one of these guys  every damn class.  (laughs)  "Maverick!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the report on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind ROAR, jet WHINE. Hollywood and Wolfman are being thr about as Hollywood fights the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Look out, you lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They depart flight. Tumble. The horizon swings wildly as  they go into flat spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A face appears at 12,000 feet, right in front of their  canopy. Goose's eyes bug at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you guys gooned it. Your laser  butts are scattered across KANSAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted with himself) Come on. I died enough for one  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb out of the simulator - A cockpit sprung on  moveable rams, surrounded by a dome on which video images projected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they climb down, Maverick and Goose climb up into the  cockpit to take their place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you guys ever considered  career counseling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56B. SIMULATOR CONTROL ROOM - Filled with computers, tape transports and video screen representations of computer  generated combat. Now Maverick flies it as Charlie and ot techs watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick flys the heck out of it. It's real. It lurches a bumps, the NOISES and sights look real. He gets on the ta of a MiG. It breaks, he breaks, then what he does is just fast to follow. It screams around in a turn. Suddenly, th is a WHUMMP...ALARMS...the lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do? You broke it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Goose enter. The techs cluster around the  keyboards trying to reprogram, to figure out what went wr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You flew it off the template.  Nobody ever did that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she said last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at Goose until he grins and moves off to give others his valuable opinions on how to reprogram the  computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just shrugs at her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say, too fast...too  quick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is combat. Every second counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hottest moves in the world  aren't gonna help you if you wind  up alone.  Your wingman's got to be  able to follow you. Trust you. Know  that he can depend on you. It's  more than just fancy flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what you need...what you have  to keep looking for...what you want  to get is a wingman who can stay up  with you. Who can match you move  for move. Then you've got  something.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff about the MiG. I was out  of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go with those moves  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mix with the boys. I work  here. Let's keep it professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break, I'm asking you  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought there was something...  That night in the club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick...you know the rules of  engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some one comes up hot on your six,  what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turn into him, check him out,  identify friend or foe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he's harmless, you  disengage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to shoot him down....If  he's smart, he'll turn away before  that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmless. Nobody ever called me  harmless before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And probably never again. It's  nothing personal. It's just...I  know a lot of pilots. Maybe I'm  immune...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm a new strain. And  I don't give up. Everything I've  ever wanted I've had to work like  hell for. Well, how about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about anything, anything you  want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to argue with that, isn't  it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A date... Coffee... A drink...A  walk in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them invite me to sit in  the cockpit...play with the levers  and things.  MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to sense that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're slow to engage. But you'll  come around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him out the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, anything. Just...go. I've  gotta work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door, turns back to her screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A day off. Pilots, other personnel are enjoying a day at beach. There are bikinis, and beer, sunfishes and water  skiing. The annual Over-the-Line (a variation of softball tournament is in progress. The team from the Teddy Kenned Driving School is whipping another known as Scum de Terre The pilots are doing pretty well at blowing off steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undulating sea grass. Muffled HISS of the surf. A pretty  fish comes into view. A spear shoots through it, and nail to the ocean floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two figures pop to the surface and wade in to the beach.  Maverick holds the wriggling fish. Charlie is repulsed. S pulls off her mask and snorkle, follows him in to shore..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flop down. He drops the fish in front of her, sees h reaction at watching its death throes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him for a moment, then turns away, fiddles w her mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't enjoy watching things  suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes the fish on a rock. It is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she looks at him strangely,   half jokes) You're horrible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not, cause you eat frozen  meatballs?   (he puts it down) Things die. Every time you breathe,  you kill millions of tiny  organisms. Every time you eat,  something had to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody does. It's more honest  this way. You do your own dirty  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about killing  another human being?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About as much as they think about  killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know the rules...(this is too  strong for her, she turns away, he  comes around to her.) That's the  deal. That's why you're up there.  It's him or me. That's the price of  admission. (she draws away) It  bothers you, why? You're part of  it. (She stiffens, he's losing her.  He softens)  Everybody dies. Most  people don't get to die for  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to confront it, do  you. You want to keep it all clean,  cerebral... velocity vectors,  wing-load diagrams...You ever been  up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You use your mind to keep things at  a distance. You ever just let go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what really scares me?  Living too long. Losing my hair and  my teeth...and my guts and my wind.  And my brains...Sitting in a room  with my hands in my lap, watching  daytime TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe any of this. You  don't think you'll ever die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, of course. When I'm up  there and doing it, I'm cheating it  every second. I'm subverting all  laws...gravity...whatever. I'm  skating the edge of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he said..."There's nothing so  exhilarating as being shot at  without result."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you've got is one life. I guess  it's worth about the same to every  body. You ever see an old woman  after her husband has died? And the  meaningless years of decline  stretch ahead...  When you're in  the air and doing something really  dangerous, you can look ahead...  maybe ten seconds. That's your  whole future. That's as far as it  goes. But imagine what those  seconds are worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you kill yourself? Think of  everything you'll miss. MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is lots of stuff I don't know  about...  Fine wine... great art...  the opera. I guess if I live long  enough, I'll get to it. If I don't,  I'll never miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head no.) I watched my mother die. Cancer.  She had a long time to think about  it. They say you reach an agreement  with death. Come to accept the fact  that pretty soon you won't be here.  I didn't see that. She... was very  brave...braver than I am. You go up  there, there isn't time to think.  If you make a mistake, you're just  a smudge on the ground. Simplifies  funeral arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he smiles) Thanks very much. (he lifts the fish) Care for some suchi?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A killer volleyball game in progress. Maverick and Charli wander toward it, talking softly to themselves. Goose run and grabs him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I got over six bucks on  the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks up and sees the other two-man team, the  victors, waiting on the other side of the net for them. O course it had to be Ice and Slider.Charlie sits and watch as the game gets immediately out of hand. In moments,  Maverick and Ice rotate to forward positions directly  opposite each other across the net. Other revelers turn t watch as it degenerates (?) to more than a game. Maverick glances at Charlie. He seems uncomfortable, but irrevocab drawn into the confrontation. She says nothing, but her  attitude is apparent. Back to the game: Slider and Goose them up, as they try to spike the ball in each other's fa The final point...up over the middle. They both go up,  Maverick smashes, Ice blocks, but the ball sails away, of his forearm. For the first time ever, Maverick beats him. looks over at Charlie, she is staring out to sea. She loo back at him and he's suddenly had enough competition. The call for another game, but Maverick turns away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! It's double or  nothing.. We're talking twelve  bucks American, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Charlie and his gear..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't like being  out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Ice, bouncing the ball and staring at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick with me, you'll get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bike doing 130, 140, 150 mph. Charlie is unfazed. He  turns to check her out, she smiles back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bike is parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE ON LOCKED OFF CAMERA - to show the passage of tim latticed terrace, streaks of light. Maverick is feeding a Charlie sits on a rail watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wanted to fly... ever  since I first saw a jet. I wanted  to fly jets, then I wanted F-14's,  then I wanted to fly off carriers,  then I wanted Top Gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always get what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts money in jukebox. She watches him...eye to eye  contact. The music comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fooling on base, no signs, no comments, no talk. By anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a professional. You guys are in my line of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. He looks at her -- makes the pact: like a  sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at his eyes for any sign of a put-on, insinceri Finally he smiles at her but she can read it. It's time. moves in and covers his grin with a gentle kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To them sitting within striking distance at a table. The sleeps beneath. Their eyes are now locked. The electricit almost arcs between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TCU Scrub pine table. Their fingertips touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT. Waist to head. Holding, close together, swayi in time with the music. Their lips gently brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An F-14 swoops over the desert, ROARS over an antenna  complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JET.- In it's missile rack, it carries a TACTS  transponder. The TACTS Range is an area of the desert  completely enveloped by computerized radar. The computers
