dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: calculate a number of aircraft's positions and velocities means of transponders in the ships and ground stations th talk to each other thousands of times a second.  Using th system, it is possible to track aerial combat instantaneo and give pilots directions and also to play back the comb for analysis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double viewing screens are five feet high; high  technology, state of the art. On the screens are computer animated figures showing jets from various angles. Flight data is displayed. The operators punch buttons to show  various points-of-view of the battle: a pilot's p.o.v.; G p.o.v. from overhead, a long range p.o.v., showing topogr of the landscape and height of mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students and instructors sit on chairs in the peanut  gallery, facing Viper at the front of the room. Charlie i the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bandit has good position right  here. All right, freeze here. The  moment of choice -- Maverick is  defensive. He has a chance to bug  out right here....Better to retire  and save your plane than force a  bad position. Stay in the diamond  another three seconds, the bandit  will blow you out of the sky...make  a hard right, select zone  5...(turns to Maverick to drive  point home) you can extend and  escape. You make a bad choice. Roll  forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computerized rendering resumes on the screen. VIPER (Con't)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You perform a split S. That's the  last thing you should do. The  bandit is right on your tail --  Freeze there...the bandit has you  in his gunsight. What were you  thinking here, Maverick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't thinking. I just did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big gamble with a thirty million  dollar plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke. Viper doesn't like that answer at all, but s of the students laugh and mockingly whistle at the cockin of it. They give Maverick the high sign. Slider leans for to him. SLIDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick slumps down in his chair under Viper's glare.  T computer rendering rolls forward again. He glances back a Charlie. She smiles sympathetically at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, the gamble worked,  or you might have learned  something. The bandit never gets a  clean shot...Maverick makes an  aggressive vertical move here,  comes over the top and defeats the  bandit with a missile shot. The  encounter was a victory, but we've  shown it as an example of what not  to do. Ice is next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another computerized rendering comes up on the screen.  Hollywood leans close to Maverick and speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick gives him a small nod of appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the dumbest...Okay, look at  this. It's textbook. Ice takes  control of the battle immediately.  He never gives the bandit a chance  to take the offensive. An early  turn here -- excellent. He goes for  the jugular, and it's over just  that quick. Let's run that again,  it's exactly how it should be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In full flight gear, carrying their helmets and trying to stuff food down their gullets, the students rush/stumble  toward the flight line. Hollywood takes a bit of a sandwi and makes a face. GOOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't chew it, you won't have it  that long. Easier to clean the  cockpit if it comes up in big  chunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the run. Let's go. Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fighter pilot's lunch... a hot  dog and a puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scurry ahead, overtaking the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a victim of circumstance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should have warned you about  that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's kinky for flight suits--said  that she'd never seen so many  zippers--played with them all  night. The noise alone kept me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of ironic. All you guys  have women troubles and I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you don't have any  women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until last night. Did you see the  moves I was making on that girl at  the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl with the purple  fingernails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her--tall hungry woman with  fire in her eyes. It was great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl with the purple  fingernails was Coogan's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh. Wolfman looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coogan spent half the night looking  for her. He said he was gonna kill  the son-of-a-bitch who ruined his  sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. She came ruined!...    Ya think he knows it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed not to. But it's hard to  know. You never can tell what's in  the mind of a psychopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfman looks very apprehensive as they approach the F-14 MECHANICS surround both planes, making last minute checks all systems. Among them is COOGAN, six and a half feet ta looking mean. Maverick tosses him a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know somethin' about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfman swallows hard and hurries quickly into the plane. Coogan glares at them all with a look that could kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood leads, Maverick follows. They point their noses down and dive. Two bogies fly side by side at five thousa outlined against the blue Pacific. Smaller, slower, they helpless for a moment. We hear the instructors in the F-5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your shirt on, he's saying  holy shit it's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bogies split. Bogey One hard left. Bogey Two hard rig Hollywood sweeps left, pursuing Bogey One. Maverick hangs back to cover him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogey One makes a strong vertical move. Hollywood stays o him. MAVERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogey One loops and comes down, and Hollywood almost lose him for a moment before regaining the angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogey at three o'clock high! Nose  on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks quickly at three o'clock high, sees Bogey returning to the fight. He jerks the stick right, and the planes make a quick pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cover Wood, Maverick. Mutual support, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be greedy. Stay with Wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick goes suddenly vertical, zooms straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick loops the F-14 down to get the quick angle on Vi in Bogey Two. Viper takes off, running from the fight aga Maverick looks over his shoulder and sees that Hollywood  still has a good position on Bogey One. He takes a hard r and streaks off after Viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What what are you doing? We're cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose looks back at Hollywood and Bogey One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper streaks across the sky with Maverick close behind. pushes the throttle forward to ZONE 5 - full afterburner. Viper shows all his tricks...hard left, hard right, rolli into vertical, flipping into a dive. Maverick stays with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick turns to get Viper in the diamond. He hears a  SIDEWINDER GROWL in his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the range, Goose. I've got a  good tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper jinks but Maverick stays with him.  Viper is in the diamond, and the TONE GOES CRAZY. But suddenly....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bogies ! Three o'clock high,  nine o'clock high! Break!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out of nowhere, flashing down toward Maverick-- crossfire ambush. Maverick's eyes are startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is stunned. He has been tricked, humiliated.  There's a little salt for the wound as Viper and Jester  celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slaps his helmet like a dolt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Several pilots in various forms of undress.  Maverick and Goose sit with their heads down, a hangdog  expression on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick mopes at the bar, a figure comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know, that was the best flying  I've seen since Nam...(He grins)  ...Right up to that part where you  got killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper sits down. He's in a jovial, taunting mood.  Maveri watches him guardedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years' experience, I  couldn't shake you. You may be a  great flyer. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you did. I said a great  flyer, not a smart one. You fly  reckless. Great instincts. No  discipline. That ambush today, you  followed your emotions instead of  your wingman. Of course you got  killed...and well deserved to. It  was a really stupid mistake. In  battle, it gets people killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick nods and stares at his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talent is no holy shield. Von  Richtofen was killed by a farm boy.  Instincts are not enough. Do it our  way. We've worked these things out.  The good pilots can become better  and the great ones can learn how to  stay alive.  (he studies him for a  moment)  Why do you have to do  everything the hard way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my own way. It works for me.   I don't care about the rest of that  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the same reason you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flying. The fighting.  I'd go  up there ten times a day to fight.  I'd win at least nine of them.  That's all I want to do. It's what  I do best. I am real good.  Just  give me the jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a gift, just a loan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his beer, then rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine out of ten is okay, as long as  it's only fun and games. But this  isn't about that. This is serious  business. It is dangerous up there!  At 500 knots, things can change a  lot in a second. Discipline is what  protects us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signals the bartender and drops some money on the bar. stretches, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a good day. You learned  something. You lost and you're  still alive to think about it. And,  you lost your wingman. That's a  cardinal sin...don't ever do it  again. You owe Hollywood an apology  and you owe me a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper touches Maverick's shoulder as he moves away. It wa just the gesture Maverick needed, for he seems to relax f his tension. He sips his beer alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Goose move through the terminal,  anxious/expectant looks on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relationships are a bitch, here.  It's hard enough to concentrate  ...under the pressure. Having a  woman here is asking for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's what I'm doing,  then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you find the time? Where  do you find the energy. It's tough  enough to keep your mind on school.  A woman here is a real pain in  the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty woman emerges from the crowd and spots them firs She rushes them, happily, carrying her sleepy four-year-o RICKY. Goose undergoes an immediate change, beaming a big smile that he has practiced on her for years. She sets do the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...butt...Hi, honey, God, am I glad  to see you! I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose wraps his arms around Carol, smack, a kiss. She smi at Maverick, turns back to Goose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to come, Willard, I got so  lonesome I just couldn't stand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, honey, I understand. It's  great to see you. Hey where's your  backseater, where's the world's  smallest RIO..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks all around and then down at the kid, hiding shyl behind his mother's skirts. Goose grabs up the kid and zo him around, a game they've played before, every six month so. The kid laughs happily.  Maverick just sort of smiles himself and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick comes to the surface. She enters frame by the si of the pool.  She hands him a split fresh pineapple. He e it in the  most salacious manner possible. He's so conten he's babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever fly an F-14? (She laughs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fly in anything that doesn't show movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out, grabs a towel, moves over to some chairs. Hi flight suit is draped over one. He moves it to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, you'd love it. Night carrier  landings! The most dangerous thing  you can think of! ...next to  you...And the most exciting. You're  living at one hundred and ten per  cent. Greatest high in the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His flight suit slips onto the ground. Charlie retrieves As she lifts the suit, something falls out of the pocket. Looks like a gold coin. She picks it up. Maverick is dryi his hair. She holds the object out to him, questioning. H sees it, quickly takes it, stuffs it back into his pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you take me for? It's a  Navy Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He roots through a picnic basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...MiG sweep over the water.  You  will proceed down the one-seven  -zero degree radial looking for  MiGs. You will engage all that you  find, destroy them, and return to  base. Maverick, has the lead. Any  questions? All right, let's go.  Move like you've got a  purpose....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four F-14's fly in formation over the Pacific, searching (MiGs). They spot them, engage. The combatants fly scisso patterns, slashing past each other, angling for position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the VOICES OF COMBAT from the planes, a barrage o information exchanges between pilots and RIO's. Maverick Ice swoop close together on each other's wing--moving on other, testing, they glance at each other and nod. The  Challenge...the fight is on. Suddenly an F-5 rises up out the clouds in front of them--Ice has the advantage and ro in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-5 sees his pursuers. Goes into a hard left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice struggles against the G's to bring his nose to bear.  They go around into a Lufbery--a tight circle, Ice has th advantage. He is closer to the F-5's tail than the F-5 is his. But he can't close, can't line up the shot. He grunt and strains as the G force pushes him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick maneuvers close to their left circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is pulling a log of G's, but can't target his  weapons, he continues to turn in a hard circle, going rou and round without gaining. He can't bring his nose to bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick dives down between the two planes pulling 6.5 G' exposing his underside to Ice. All Ice sees is belly.  Obviously, in this attitude Maverick can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the stick hard right in toward Maverick.  Ice quickly rolls up right, in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick sees him flash into his view. He has to slam the stick forward to avoid collision. He swings by real close Too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through Ice's turbulence. The blast distorts th airflow to Maverick's left engine. BOOMBOOMBOOM. The engi flames out. Full thrust on the right, engine swings the t around in a yaw. Maverick slams the stick right to correc but too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane's coupling up! Plane's  coupling up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane couples one yaw to the next--the tail swings  around-- which becomes an ever increasing flat spin, like out-of -control frisbee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not good!...(Rising panic)  We're low!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is pinned to the instrument panel by centrifugal force, desperately tries to reach back for the ejection  lever--but is falling short by about a foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is spinning ever faster, out of control. He dro the gear. Still spins. Goose is closer to center of spin- forces are less. He reaches behind him for the eject hand starts the eject sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I can't reach. 2000 feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The canopy BLASTS away--but is held spinning above the  cockpit by the vortex of the sinking jet. Goose glances u it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goose yanks the ejection handle. Things happen in a split second. Goose is fired up and out by the rocket under his seat. Almost instantly he impacts the spinning canopy. A  sickening CRUNCH. The canopy is knocked away. Maverick is slammed back in his seat as the ejection seat straps wind He is BLASTED out of the plane just before it spins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in shock..the loud THUMPING of his heart, labored  breathing, a scream that stays in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively, he gropes for straps. He releases the pilo seat, it tumbles away. His chute streams, balloons open,  snapping his body like a bullwhip.  He drifts momentarily then plunges into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face, distorted in the water; wild eyes, disoriented, choking for air. He reaches out, finds nothing to grab. Suddenly, he is yanked hard to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parachute is caught by the wind, and dragged, pulling Maverick along beneath the surface. He is twisting in the water, turning over and over, trying desperately to slip of the tangled straps. He finally hits the surface of the water and sucks air into his lungs. With the end of his  strength, he hits the release snaps and breaks free from parachute. It whips away like a kite in a typhoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sea is choppy and rough. He struggles as his equipmen drags him under. He twists, finds the inflatable raft  attached to his harness. Maverick pulls the cord, and the raft hisses open. He pulls his body into the six-by-two f raft and collapses, completely exhausted. The survival ha been almost without thinking: an instinctual physical  struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick begins to focus on the situation. He stains the  water with dye, then sees another parachute floating near Paddling to the parachute, he reaches over the side and  begins to pull on the heavy cords that are submerged in t water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great struggle. The weight is extremely heavy. Finally, pulls a body to the surface. Goose. Goose is dead. Maveri releases the parachute and pulls Goose into the raft on t of him. He holds Goose in his arms. His mind shuts down  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above the ocean, we see the debris on the water An oil slick, pieces of honeycomb titanium, and the small helpless figure in the raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searchlights skim over the black ocean. A brilliant light flashes as Maverick pops a pencil flare. Helicopter blade flick powerfully. The lights of the choppers descend towa the wreckage area, scanning the debris, searching for lif The spotlights find Maverick and Goose in the raft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The draft from the chopper churns the water. A FROGMAN dr from the chopper and hits with a heavy splashes. He surfa and swims to the raft as a rescue harness is lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick watches curiously as he starts to examine Goose. hugs Goose closer and looks threatened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go, sir. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to pry Goose free, but Maverick has a death grip the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir! Let him go. It's all right.  Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick glares at the man as he bobs in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long moment, then Maverick releases Goose. The  frogman quickly straps Maverick into the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV. - He watches the lifeless body in the water as h is pulled up and away. He shivers from the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme CLOSE ON Maverick's face. He is emotionless. His  eyes are flat and absolutely without expression. There is complete silence in the room. Then we hear the quiet, cal probing voice of Viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one sign of emotion from Maverick. Not one tone of  expression. We see Viper now, and his face is strained fr very long day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fly jets long enough,  something like this happens to you.  No one escapes it. It touches us  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks at Viper, and his eyes are very disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first squadron in Vietnam, we  lost eight out of eighteen planes.  Ten guys. The first one kills you,  but there'll be others--you can  count on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction from Maverick. He can't quite face up to that reality right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to put him in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is watching Viper, but he doesn't have anything say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO plays John Lennon; "Stand by Me". Maverick open his eyes, doesn't know where he is for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark side. The price you pay  for all the fun you're having. You  knew about it, of course. Didn't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a friend of mine. A good  guy...great guy. It was my  fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you get flight pay for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In surprise) Why? You act like you didn't know  one day this would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew it. You all do. It's part  of it. Maybe the most important  part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's car pulls up. They get out and walk down toward the water. Maverick seems dazed. She is softly taunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? You know where we  are. It's called the beach. It's  where life first crawled up out of  the sea. I come here sometimes...  when I feel like crawling back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what, show you a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good company. I should be  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, but if that's  what you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there, not making a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, nods out, past the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look way out there. Out past  the date line. West becomes East,  all things change. You cross the  line...today becomes yesterday...or  tomorrow, I forget which.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course the line's just  imaginary. You can cross it twenty  times...nothing really changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks along the surfline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beach... It's what they say  when Navy men retire...He's "On The  Beach". I always liked that. I had  a picture...in my head... all these  old guys wandering around here,  looking out into the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the surf, kicks the sand with his bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we knew then, what we know now,  we might never have come up out of  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her. She just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when you're depressed. Then it  passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything passes. Immutable law of  the Universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a piece of flotsam, a twig, worn smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This too...shall pass. You put as  much life as you can between it and  you. You start piling up experience  between then and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do when you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sit. I think. I play games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strip reality, actually, like  what the pilots always want to  play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this gets a small laugh) Strip reality! How do you play  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like strip poker, only,  without the bluffing. (he laughs  again) One person says something  and if the other one accepts that  it's true, the one who says it,  gets to take one item of clothing  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. (She stops, he goes  on, softer) That's a pretty silly  game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as silly as some. You know the  silliest one? ...that we are gods.  That we control events on the  beach... that we can turn back  time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say the truth. (a beat...)     Go ahead. Don't be afraid. You want  to win the game, don'tcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big one. The one that's most on  your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the ribbon from her hair. It falls down over her face and shoulders. Now it's her turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. She slowly loosens his tie and pulls it from aro his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing, stands looking into his eyes. He slowly as if in a trance, takes her blouse off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to reach for her. She pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and thinks for a moment, looking at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather than struggle his T shirt over his head, she grabs with both hands. She leans in close and bites it. She gra both sides of the tear and slowly rips it off his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head no) That wasn't fair. It was a  question. Penalty round!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't mean it. You didn't  think. You'd do anything to take it  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unbuckles his belt, slowly slides it off. She unzips pants, they fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests his head on her shoulder, unhooks her bra. She  shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand on the beach in shorts and bikini bottom, look into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll say it together. On the count  of three...One...two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning in, softer and harder...they both jump the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace madly and sink to the sand. From the distanc it looks like a strange slithering creature crawling back the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are out in Goose's room at the Bachelor Office Quarters. The door opens, and Maverick enters. He sets a  cardboard box on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silently, Maverick gathers together Goose's few personal  possessions. He fills the box with clothes, books, a cloc radio, a walkman, and articles from the bathroom. He exam each closely, like an artifact...as if he might find some message or meaning in them. He fumbles them into the box. can't see too well, his eyes are full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick closes the box and carries it to the door. He ta one last glance around, then leaves and closes the door  behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol and the kid, stand, staring at a silent TV. Carol  looks dazed, lost. Maverick walks in, finds her. An awkwa silence while they both try to think of something to say. Maverick hands the box to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits staring right through us...the thousand-yard star A strange white unreal light washes over him. The only co the Navy and gold of the stripes on his shoulderboards. A rumbling mumbling filters through the HISS of surf or fan something...Snatches of low whispered  conversation....disregard of...basic air-safety  principles...too aggressive...incident.... 29 July...with performance parameters... disciplinary action...tactical  doctrine.... even reckless at times...  conjecture...unsupported ...benefit of the doubt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's  eyes slowly focus. The light attenuates. The surrounding  image becomes denser. Things become real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOARD OF INQUIRY, a COMMANDER and other NAVY OFFICERS  seated behind tables at the front of the room. Maverick f them, wearing dress whites. Viper is also present. The  Commander looks at each of the Officers. They each nod, i turn, indicating readiness. The Commander turns to Maveri and states for the record:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board of Inquiry finds that Lt.  Evan Mitchell was not at fault in  the accident of twenty-nine July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response from Maverick, one way or the other. Viper  studies his face with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Mitchell's record will be  cleared of this incident.

dialogues.speaker: CDR.
dialogues.text: Lt. Mitchell is restored to flight  status without further delay. These  proceedings are closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick lies on his bunk and stares at the ceiling. The  phone next to his bed is RINGING.  It RINGS EIGHT OR NINE TIMES, then stops. He makes no move to reach for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick sits in the cockpit staring at the controls whil the ground crew preps the aircraft for flight. Coogan hel him strap in. He speaks solicitously to Maverick. It is  unheard over the JET NOISE and RADIO BABBLE. Maverick loo at the cockpit as if it's a strange territory, suddenly  foreign to him. He grabs the stick like it's some peculia talisman. He turns and looks aft. He seems surprised that moves the control surfaces in the tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick checks ten o'clock low. He is disturbed. He trie to make the move, but he is a man with no secret: he is  afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bogey abruptly turns into him. Maverick hesitates. Th suddenly, he jerks the stick hard right and takes the F-1 away from the bogey at great speed. Fungus is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester walks up to Viper who waits near an F-5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just won't engage. He can't do  it, Skipper. He can't get back on  the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only been a week. Keep sending  him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guys never get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick grabs his stuff out of the locker, throws them i bag. He glances up as Fungus enters, continues to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when did you care about   paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick walks away. Fungus hesitates, then follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could fly like you I'd have  everything I want. If I could fly  at all. I can't fly. I can't fly  like that. Nobody can. Whatever it  is, you've got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're scared--so what? You  ever get a good look at me in the  back seat, I'm goddamn terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing the suitcase, Maverick brushes past Jester and  walks up the corridor. Jester and Fungus watch him go. Fu goes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie parks her car, jumps out, and runs toward the mai entrance to the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hurries through the crowd, bumping past people,  searching frantically for Maverick in the huge terminal. moves past bench after bench, and her eyes flick in all  directions. A quick glance at the souvenir shop, the coff shop, and then she heads for the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick is there, sitting alone in a booth with his  suitcase beside him, staring into a drink. Charlie compos herself, then walks to the booth and sits down across the table from him. Maverick does not look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up trying to be angry, but he can't help it, she makes him laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came to the right place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have what he's having...  Hemlock, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress departs. He tries not to smile, but can't he it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long distance? I wouldn't do that  to you. I'd at least talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to see you. I mean, I  did...but I didn't..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I've got a gift just like you do.  My gift is I just know what people  mean, even if they can't say it. It  helps when you're trying to  communicate with fighter pilots.  Like what you just said was "I'm  embarrassed, I feel I've done  something wrong, that I've failed,  and I don't think I can live up to  the expectations of a wonderful  interesting, intelligent woman like  yourself." That about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna sneak off, and be by  myself for awhile, like until I can  think of a new career...hotel  management or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big talk for someone who's never  been shot off her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I never said I was a fighter  pilot...I never claimed to think it  was fun to be shot off the end of a  ship in a storm. I can find  contentment in a good book. I don't  have to roar by someone at Mach two  with my hair on fire. Sometimes...I  just get happy being with the right  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have... I could be wrong.  I have been before. Just remember  one thing. If you're not Top Gun,  if you're not fighting jets, you're  not gonna be able to act like a  fighter pilot... You're gonna have  to act like the rest of us. You're  gonna have to master humility. For  you guys, that's the toughest  maneuver of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up...lays a bill out for the drinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Sailor. See you on the  beach sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings away. Her wake sucks in the stares of every ma in the place. Then they look over to Maverick, quick flic of envy in their eyes. He stares them back and can't quit meet their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper is tugged down the beach by a three year old kid. T come across one creature who's had a bad night...Viper sp him, he spots Viper, and Viper moves toward him. Tim, Vip kid, wants to head for the sea and pulls his father in th direction. He stops, puts his hand on his hips like he's the pilots do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...Of all the aminals in the  ocean, which one's the baddest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Tim. You'll have to  ask them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper turns to the creature, Maverick, and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you took your kid to the   each. Every second Sunday. Zoo or  beach or the ballgame. Y'have the  option...(Maverick thinks for a  beat. Segues to the question...)  What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can send you back to your  squadron with nothing noted on your  record except "CNC" --course not  completed, no explanation required.  Theoretically, it doesn't hurt your  career, but people always wonder  about things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know either. That's why I  told Jester to prepare your papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick looks irritated. Viper stops at an icecream vend and orders three with a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already made up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no disgrace, kid. That spin  was hell. It would wreck anyone's  confidence. You could be a good  pilot again someday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to get his back up) You think I should quit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. That's up to  you. But I have responsibility for  the other guys up there, not just  you. They need to know you're all  right...that they can depend on  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vendor hands them icecream, they take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me get this. We'll be  even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his pocket for change, comes out with a  handful. Slams it on the counter, stars picking the prope change out. Viper spots something and reaches for  it...Maverick sees and tries to block it, but Viper comes with the Navy Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Viper recognizes it for what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes it's luck, but in this  case, he earned it... I served with  your old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VF 51, the Oriskany. You remind me  of him. You're just like he was,  only better...and worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not think so, but you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was by the book, all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They waved him off. He thought he  knew better. He hit the  ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper looks at him, for a long beat, throws his icecream  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, walks away. Maverick stands there for a moment, thinking, then catches up to him, stops him...struggles w the thought...as Viper breaks in...  VIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start on a wrong heading... the  more you stick to it, the further  you get from your target. A good  pilot always questions himself,  always questions his judgments,  stays alert for drift and makes the  corrections...You may find a little  discipline helps with the fear. You  don't have to be alone up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I go on? I feel so...  responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, the plain fact is...you are.  I'm not gonna stand here and blow  sunshine up your ass. Technically,  they absolved you. You and I know  what really happened. You pushed  it. You are responsible and you'll  always carry that. You know what,  I'll carry it too. I should have  taken you out of that cockpit. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic...  I always try to find something  worthwhile in someone's death. It's  no trade-off. It's not one for one.  What you learned isn't worth his  death. It couldn't be. But maybe  there is some value in it. I know  it's the first thing I've ever seen  that's really gotten to you. Now  the question is, what will you do  with it. If it gets you out of  flight status...so you don't kill  yourself or anybody else...that's  good. That's one good thing. You  were an accident waiting to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. That's up to  you. I think that if you do, if you  choose to come back, you'll be a  better pilot... a better man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you take me back? Would they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to think about it. I  don't know about them. I do know  one thing, We've got a lot invested  in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even  more than those other guys, Naval  Aviation needs a very few, very  good men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD ROCK AND ROLL. The graduation ceremonies are in full swing...They consist of informal ribbing, laughing, and a of talking with the hands. every now and then, the name G comes up and a shadow passes across a face. For the most  part, they press on, having a good time. Fungus shrugs at someone's question and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice stands proudly holding the Top Gun plaque as others  congratulate him...Hollywood looks up as the door opens,  Maverick is there.  He looks uncomfortable, unsure. He se Ice with the plaque. Fungus moves over to him, brings him FUNGUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, they come over, shake his hand. Viper stands  there, looking pleased but gruff. Maverick walks over, sh his hand. The party starts to pick up. A real celebration now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester enters, a sheaf of messages in his hand. He takes  Viper aside for a word. Viper nods at him. The group's  attention gradually swings onto them. They quiet down  instinctively. Viper finally turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you know how I hate to  break up this party before it has a  chance to get really out of hand... (more serious) ...but there's a major flap on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on your way. Don't bother  going to BOQ. Your bags are packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands them orders. Someone turns the music back up... they shake hands all around, the music grows, becomes pur as the background voices drop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To include his helmet. Stereo headphones from his walkman carry the same music from the party as he sits in the coc and stares at the grey water rushing under. He sits in hi Tomcat on Ready 5 Alert. In the back, Fungus plays a hand computer game - Jet Attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's Tomcat sits waiting for a launch order on the  forward catapult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over the briefing in his mind...Stinger's voice  breaks through the music.:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Navy oceanographic ship...  international waters... fired  upon... unknown forces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In full flight gear, sixteen teams of fighter pilots and  RIO's pay close attention to the Squadron CO, Stinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...by unknown forces...by Migs. We  don't know who they are.  All I  know is that it's our ship, and our  orders are to escort it out of the  area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinger circles an area on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies his copy of the same map, headings and vectors pencilled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is "Bullseye". A rescue  operation is to begin within the  hour. Your mission is to give air  support to that rescue. There are  MiGs in the area, and tensions are  high. If you witness a hostile act  you will return fire. We will be  covering 360 degrees of the compass  by section. Be prepared for  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinger is speaking to individual pilots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Maverick who stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Maverick. You'll back them up,  on Ready Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment's disappointment passes so fleetingly, you hardl see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the aircrews file out, tense but excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes search the horizon, while Slider and Wolfman  watch their instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two jets streak across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there are BLIPS on the radar scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MiGs flying low to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join together in a box formation, begin to circle the are

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE
dialogues.text: 2-7-0 at 10 MILES. WE NEED SOME  HELP HERE, MUSTANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick sits in his Tomcat on the Catapult on ready aler listening to the message traffic. He gets a launch order, turns to the LSO. The LSO salutes, Maverick salutes and f him the bird. The LSO drops to the deck. Maverick is slam back as the F-14 is fired off the deck and rockets into t sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MiGs cross in a scissor pattern in their path... provocation...they join together again and fly level at t thousand feet. One of the MiGs does a sudden canopy roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A FLASH! Suddenly, Out of nowhere, Hollywood's hit. WHAM! Just that fast, he's hit and goes down.  His f-14  disappears into the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice puts his nose down and follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes out of clouds at 1500, nothing but empty water  below. ICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have them? Did they get out  or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Dive on those bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, engage. This is it.  Get your nose in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick hesitates again. He sees the hornet's nest below planes all over the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bandit at seven o'clock low--solo.  Take him. Pull on the goddamn  stick, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me okay. Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick draws a breath, then forces himself to pull the  stick over. The F-14 rolls in hard toward the battle.  Suddenly, the cluster breaks apart. The MiGs break in eve direction as Maverick BLASTS through their formation.  Something comes up through the clouds. A MiG BLASTS by.  Another rolls in and locks onto them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MiGs swarm toward the TOMCATS, coming from every  direction. CANNON FIRE erupts from one of the MiGs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-14's execute a left oblique turn in unison. They co down in a section attack with their cannons blazing. From Maverick's cockpit, everything looks choppy:  MiGs slide at incredible speed. Cannons BLAST, as the planes scrambl for position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out-numbered four to two, Maverick and Ice fight  defensively. Maverick has the angle on a MIG, when Fungus spots a missile launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick releases a flare as he takes the F-14 into a har left. The missile tracks the heat of the flare and sails of the area, missing the Tomcat and falling toward the se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick jerks his stick right and streaks toward Ice. He cuts off one of the MiGs with CANNON FIRE, driving it dow toward the deck. Ice goes into vertical and comes around gain an angle on the other MiG. His RIO is in position to check Mav's rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick turns to look and jerks a hard left. The MiG is him, CANNON BLAZING. Ice Yo Yos inside and cuts the MiG o ICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires a sidewinder. The MiG turns hard, the missile sa away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice's F-14 is suddenly caught in a HAIL OF CANNON FIRE as MiG sweeps down from three o'clock. He breaks, dives. The jets streak across the sky, low to the deck, skimming the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's F-14 Rollaways in and intercepts the bogey on  Ice's tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice turns right, the MiG bugs and jerks into vertical.   Maverick swoops after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick closes, jerking left, right, twisting and turnin staying on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS fly by Maverick's F-14 from the MiG on his six. H pulls a hard left, then takes the plane straight up. We h instructions shouted by Fungus, but it is all obscured in SOUNDS AND FURY OF THE BATTLE. Maverick peels over the to and comes down like a comet. A series of passes at the Mi As they come by, one of the MiGs pulls up,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up. An MiG 21 is coming down, belly to them, cl to a mid-air collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes down. The MiG ROARS BY. The whole airplane goes "BOOOMMMM" it's that close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock, the air pressure SLAMS them as it goes by,  missing by 4-5 feet. Maverick pulls back in, sees a MiG 2 below. It takes off, bugging out. Ice goes after him. The maneuvers, jerking hard left, hard right, twisting  up, d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice is right in his shadow. They come in hard and low ove the sea. He has the MiG in the diamond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile goes by the tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his tail comes off, the airplane goes over, a chute  comes out. The MiG EXPLODES into a thousand small pieces. They roar by the MiG pilot hanging in his straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling down on him, good SIDEWINDER TONE. The MiG'S sens him, they break, one guy down low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vapor trail comes off, the MiG 21 turns like he's bee bounced off a rubber wall, comes around on the missile, b it. The missile flies by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MiG comes back turning into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back. 30 millimeter tracers go by; they just kin of float. He breaks, hits airbrakes, the trailing MiG div through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly another MiG appears, rocketing straight for him. They close at 900 knots--VABOOOM!--They pass nose to nose canopy to canopy. Both planes pitch straight up, trying f the altitude advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-14 outclimbs the MiG sitting on its tail, full  thruster, it rockets straight up, away from the planet.   Maverick has the advantage. Suddenly, his F-14 runs out o energy. FUNGUS is the first to call it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane backs down on itself, backs into its own smoke it flips over, falls away...He catches it, just regains  control, when...A ROAR. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECOND MIG coming down. Right on him. It fills the Canopy Instinctive - A Push to miss him, Maverick breaks fast do into him, a last ditch maneuver, and the airplane  DEPARTS...the roll rates and the pitch rates combine and tumbles over the top; the airplane just goes end-over-end They are being slammed and rattled all over the  cockpits...bone-jarring, neck-snapping whips. SHRIEKS and SCREAMS from the airframe. Terriflying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangely calm) Goddamnit, Mav, you really are a  slow learner. Don't worry, Fung,  I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fungus is getting his teeth rattled. He's helpless, he ha no controls, there's nothing he can do but hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't WORRY!!!?   You've GOT it!!?  Are you CRAZY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane's gyrations are rattling Fungus's helmet off th canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got it?   Good!  Cause for a  minute there, you had me worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It yaws and rolls, starts into a spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now have you got it?  Have you  still got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in a progressive spiral, nose low.  The altimeter unwinds, speed picks up. The G forces are forcing them aw from the axis of spin, jamming Maverick against the  instrument panel at the front of the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fungus, also, is jammed to his panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is closer to the center of spin and less strongly held It doesn't do much good, however, he can't control the pl The only thing he can reach is the yellow and black loop; ejection handle. He reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fungus's eyes are wide.  The earth grows larger as it ris towards them. G forces flatten them. They've long since l the MiG. Nobody but an idiot would try to follow them in maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUNGUS grabs the ejection handle with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet is standing on its nose, gaining speed, plunging  towards the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3,000 feet.  We gotta go, man.   3,000 feet, we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go. I'm staying with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, just as suddenly, as he's about to pull...Maverick  catches it. The plane responds. They're out of the spin. gets control. Fungus sits there dumbly, hands on handle.  Still not believing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick stops the tumble, pulls the nose up quickly and F-l4 sweeps into level flight no more than a hundred feet above the deck. He comes up and looks right at Ice. Ice i down low. He comes around, a MiG-21 all over him like a c suit. A flick, a whip, and Maverick in perfect position,  rolls right in on the MiG. Fungus looks like he just saw  Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the Mig target set-up in front of him in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you plan that? Was all that  something you planned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick's acquired the target and is all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...if that was... Next time  you tell me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick breaks down, Ice zooms up, breaks in and takes t MiG the other way. Maverick Yo Yo's in, comes right up be the MiG, as the MiG starts acceleration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick rolls in on Ice and the MiG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice breaks left, drops flares. The MiG's missile follows flares. Maverick FIRES. The missile doesn't twitch. It fl right up the tail pipe of the MiG, the canopy flies off, pilot comes out of it, and then the MiG blows up, We go r through the fire ball. VVVARRRUOOMMM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MiG rolls into the ground...KABOOM!  They swoop by th pilot, hanging in his straps...He watches them, dumbly.  Fungus waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dope! Maybe they'll give him another plane...and we can shoot him down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick and Ice join up, light it, stand on their burner and blast straight for the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, a triple roll, as the elation hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fungus nervously looks around at his circuit breakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess it is. We did it! We  did it...Damn! We sure did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice considers for a moment, then responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know....Aw hell, let's do  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...shit! Go ahead. I'm right  behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128.  PRI-FLY BRIDGE - (Primary Flight Control)  USS KITT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Boss speaks to Maverick over the UHF. The Admiral the XO and other officers watch and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surpressing a grin) ...Likes to break at 600, 'stead of  300 knots. The Air Boss hates him.  One time, he came over the deck at  two hundred, shakes the shit out of  the bridge. Lifted Johnson right  off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over at Ice, who gives him thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral looks out over the water and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Boss is livid. He clenches the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the Admiral pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral looks at the others, tries to surpress his ow grin. He slides into his (borrowed) command chair, looks the wind. On the back of the chair, a clue; his name and  rank:  RADM. Buford Clancy, "BOOMER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIR BOSS burns, but has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really pissed off) ROGER, GHOST RIDER, YOU'RE CLEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailors line the deck and search the sky. They crane thei necks from their battle stations, sweating into the sun,  watching for the approach of F-14's. Someone sees it--he  points and SHOUTS. The F-14 appears, and every man stands CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE COME SCREAMING IN, 5 FEET OVER THE WATER, throwing up  rooster tails behind. WE SPLIT OFF and ZOOM along each si of the carrier, at 100 feet and ROLL IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lifts the Air Boss right off his feet. The walls warp, dust sifts from the overhead. The whole tower just goes B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break at 500 knots. Ice is first down over the ramp, waved in.  The F-14 comes in a little rocky. It bounces h but grabs the wire, then jerks to a sudden halt. The sail CHEER AND APPLAUD, throwing fists of victory into the air straining to get a look at Ice as the crew directs his pl off to the side. Opening the canopy, Ice and Slider unstr Stinger and the others are there. Guys are climbing up,  climbing all over the airplane. They're already painting MiG on the side, and they're looking at Ice in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches the wire, the view slams down toward the deck the plane arrests, then comes up...He releases the cockpi and can hear the ROAR OF THE CROWD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the nose around past Ice's. Ice's plane is cove in colored jerseys as the ground crew pulls him out.  Maverick's plane swings towards the PRI-FLY BRIDGE. Pilot flightsuits pour from the deck hatch APPLAUDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maverick and Fungus climb down, they see their wingmen the deck. Ice is looking in Maverick's direction. His fac inscrutable. Maverick gets mobbed, but pushes over to Ice They stare at each other for a moment, eye to eye even as they are buffeted by the crowd. Finally, Ice breaks...a g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe me anything. We're on the same team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved our lives. You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a hell of a flyer. (he can't resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be my wingman any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Ice laughs. Nobody's ever gonna win on this one. But smiles at him...It's now a running joke between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Slider snap to and proudly salute. Maverick  hesitates, then returns it. As Ice and Slider snap it off turns into the pilot's salute, they give them the bird.  Maverick and Fungus laugh and return the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are mobbed by sailors, Maverick is elated to see familiar figures: Hollywood and Wolfman turn from their  battle damaged TOMCAT on the forward elevator as it sinks of sight below decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got our radio, and an engine. We  were lucky to make it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stinger rushes up, grabs Ice and Maverick in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MiG killers! You name it, boy.  Sky's the limit. You name it. A  medal. Anything you want. Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MiG killers!  What else is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick grins, turns away from them.  He he looks out, a the dying sun glinting over the sea. He thinks how beauti it is out here! Fungus grabs him from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? Anything we want.  Anything...Well???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't seem to want to come up  anymore. There's nothing on the  scopes. In fact, everybody's  denying the incident ever happened.  So...what is it?  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick turns away, considering the options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Tomcat rolls up to park nearby. He looks  at the plane. Over the deck LOUDSPEAKER, comes the  final call to the F-14:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viper, Jester and others walk out of hangar to watch a wi return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEIR POV. Suddenly an F-14 breaks, ROARS in over the fie inverted, a hundred feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's in trouble and he didn't  even get here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jester looks over at an admiral, who steps out of a staff car, squints up at the swooping plane, turns, barks an or to his driver, jumps in the car and SLAMS the door, the c takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MP jeeps - lights flashing, pull out and head for the fli line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet breaks at 500 knots and sets down neatly on the  tarmac. The rest of his flight follows in perfect formati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unbuckles his straps, takes his helmet off. He looks o at the approaching caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they know we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You did the flying, I'll do  the talking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up in the cockpit, gives a snappy salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Admiral....How really good it  is to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick turns away. As he backs down the steps, a jeep  screeches up, doors slam open, footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's answered automatically, but now it hits him. He know the voice. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long, you keep that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops down, stands there speechless, grinning happily a her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your F-14, you got Top Gun,  you got your MiGs....You're our new  Top Gun instructor...Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...I'll think of something...  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got her on that one. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her. Self-conscious, she pulls aw a little embarrassed to show this on the flight line. He  laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I always look forward  to a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she laughs back and puts her arms around him. She kis him and now she doesn't give a damn who sees it.
